Next BAGnewsSalon: Looking at Michelle O

Dec 17, 2008

I’ve been producing online salons for the blog BAGnewsNotes.  Academics, photographers, and blog readers get together to discuss visual politics.  At the next Salon scheduled for mid-January, we’ll be looking at the media’s portrayal of Michelle Obama.

Looking at Michelle O

Sunday, January 11th, 2008
5:00 – 7:30 pm PST, 8:00-9:30 pm EST
http://bagnewsnotes.typepad.com/bagnewssalon

Michelle Obama is an assertive, attractive, professional, African American woman who is about to become America’s first lady.  This combination of qualities poses a unique challenge to the American visual media.  How are they handling it?  At this BAGnewsSALON, we will examine a series of images that have circulated in the visual media in the post-election period.

The BAGnewsSalon is an on-line, real-time chat discussion of selected images between invited guests and readers of BAGnewsNotes on the blog.  It’s open to the public, so drop by is you want to listen in or contribute to the conversation!
